description:
This module allows connecting, querying, and updating JDBC datasources.

The results of a query are returned as a sequence of objects: { column: value } . The type of the value depends on the type of the column in the database:
JDBC TypesJSONiq Type
integer, bigint, smallint, tinyintinteger
decimal, double, float, numeric, realdouble
boolean, bitboolean
char, blob, longvarchar, longnvarchar, nchar, nclob, nvarchar, varchar, sqlxml, date, time, timestampstring
binary, blob, longvarbinary, varbinary, array, datalink, java_object, other, refbase64Binary

If the value of a column is null, it is mapped to the JSONiq null value.

Connecting to a JDBC source requires the following options:

  • url: the JDBC connection URI (mandatory)
  • user: the user used for connecting (optional)
  • password: the password used for connecting (optional)

Examples: 

  •  {
   "url" : "jdbc:mysql://localhost/testdb",
   "user" : "root",
   "password" : ""
 }
  •  {
   "url" : "jdbc:sqlserver://192.168.1.1;databaseName=testdb",
   "user" : "sa",
   "password" : ""
 }
  •  {
   "url" : "jdbc:postgresql://localhost/testdb",
   "user" : "root",
   "password" : ""
 }

Currently, the 28.io platform supports connections to

  • MySQL using the mariadb-java-client.jar version 1.1.2,
  • PostgreSQL using postgresql.jar version 9.2, and
  • Microsoft SQL Server using sqljdbc4.jar version 4.0.

If you are interested in connecting to other JDBC datasources, please contact us at support@28.io.

Important Notice Regarding Function Determinism

The non side-effecting functions:

  • connect#0
  • connect#1
  • connect#2
  • execute-query#2
  • execute-query-prepared#1
  • tables#1
  • tables#4
are declared deterministic, which means that their results could be cached when invoked multiple times with the same arguments in the same query execution.

To not use cached results you can use the following alternative functions:

  • connect-notdeterministic#0
  • connect-notdeterministic#1
  • connect-notdeterministic#2
  • execute-query-notdeterministic#2
  • execute-query-prepared-notdeterministic#1
  • tables-notdeterministic#1
  • tables-notdeterministic#4
which have been declared as being non deterministic.

functions.summary: Return the number of affected rows of an updating DataSet.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: The identifier of the DataSet.

returns.description: the number of affected rows.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: connect-nondeterministic
functions.description:
Open a connection to a database using the default credentials.

This function has the same semantics as connect#0, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database using the default credentials.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

functions.name: connect-nondeterministic
functions.description:
Open a connection to a database.

This function has the same semantics as connect#1, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database.

parameters.name: connection-config
parameters.description: object containing the configuration information.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">NOT-FOUND The specified credentials have not been found.</xqdoc:error>

Open a connection to a database.

This function has the same semantics as connect#2, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database.

parameters.name: connection-config
parameters.description: object containing the configuration information.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: object to specify additional connection options.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">NOT-FOUND The specified credentials have not been found.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: connect
functions.description:
Open a connection to a database using the default credentials.

This function is declared as deterministic and should be used whenever result caching is acceptable.

The function returns an opaque URI that can represents the connection. This URI has to be passed to other functions of this module that require the $conn parameter as a first argument.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database using the default credentials.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

functions.name: connect
functions.description:
Open a connection to a database.

This function is declared as deterministic and should be used whenever result caching is acceptable.

The input to the function contains the connection information. If a string is used, then the function will interpret it as credential name and will connect using the JDBC credentials with the specified name. If an object is used, then the function will open a connection using it. The object's required structure is described in the module's description.

The function returns an opaque URI that can represents the connection. This URI has to be passed to other functions of this module that require the $conn parameter as a first argument.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database.

parameters.name: connection-config
parameters.description: object containing the configuration information.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">NOT-FOUND The specified credentials have not been found.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: connect
functions.signature: ($connection-config as item(), $options as object()?) as anyURI
functions.description:
Open a connection to a database.

This function is declared as deterministic and should be used whenever result caching is acceptable.

The input to the function contains the connection information. If a string is used, then the function will interpret it as credential name and will connect using the JDBC credentials with the specified name. If an object is used, then the function will open a connection using it. The object's required structure is described in the module's description.

In addition to the connection configuration, the function allows to specify several options:

  • autocommit: true/false turn on/off auto commit (default: true)
  • readonly: true/false configure readonly/write on this connection (default: false)
  • isolation-level: configure the isolation level for this connection
    • READ-COMMITTED: set the isolation level read-committed
    • READ-UNCOMMITTED: set the isolation level read-uncommitted
    • READ-REPEATABLE: set the isolation level repeatable-read
    • SERIALIZABLE: set the isolation level serializable
    If no isolation level is provided by the user the connection will be created with the default isolation level of the database.

The function returns an opaque URI that represents the connection. This URI has to be passed to other functions of this module that require the $conn parameter as a first argument.
functions.summary: Open a connection to a database.

parameters.name: connection-config
parameters.description: object containing the configuration information.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: object to specify additional connection options.

returns.description: an identifier that represents the connection to the server.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">NOT-FOUND The specified credentials have not been found.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: connection-options
functions.description:
Return a set with options for a specified connection. The returned options are equal to the options specified in function jdbc:connect. Consequently, the options are specified as follows:
  • autocommit: true/false shows auto commit
  • readonly: true/false shows if the connection is readonly/write
  • isolation-level: shows the isolation level for this connection
    • READ-COMMITTED: isolation level is read-committed
    • READ-UNCOMMITTED: isolation level is read-uncommitted
    • READ-REPEATABLE: isolation level is repeatable-read
    • SERIALIZABLE: isolation level is serializable
functions.summary: Return a set with options for a specified connection.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier of the connection.

returns.description: an object with the connection options.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-prepared
functions.description:
Execute SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement,
 after setting the parameters values accordingly and returns an identifier to
 a Dataset.
functions.summary: Execute SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement, after setting the parameters values accordingly and returns an identifier to a Dataset.

parameters.name: prepared-statement
parameters.description: The identifier of the prepared statement.

returns.description: the identifier of a DataSet.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-query-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $sql as string) as object()*
functions.description:
Execute non-updating SQL statements.

This function has the same semantics as execute-query#2, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Execute non-updating SQL statements.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier of the active connection.

parameters.name: sql
parameters.description: The query string to be executed.

returns.description: an object with the result data rows from the query provided.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-query-prepared-nondeterministic
functions.description:
Execute non-updating SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement, after setting the parameters values accordingly.

This function has the same semantics as execute-query-prepared#1, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Execute non-updating SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement, after setting the parameters values accordingly.

parameters.name: prepared-statement
parameters.description: The identifier of the prepared statement.

returns.description: an object with the result data rows from the query processed with the parameters provided.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL005 The prepared statement is an updating query.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-query-prepared
functions.description:
Execute non-updating SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement, after setting the parameters values accordingly.

This function is declared as deterministic and should be used whenever result caching is acceptable.

Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation, as in the module description.
functions.summary: Execute non-updating SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement, after setting the parameters values accordingly.

parameters.name: prepared-statement
parameters.description: The identifier of the prepared statement.

returns.description: an object with the result data rows from the query processed with the parameters provided.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL005 The prepared statement is an updating query.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-query
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $sql as string) as object()*
functions.description:
Execute non-updating SQL statements.

This function is declared as deterministic and should be used whenever result caching is acceptable.

Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation, as in the module description.
functions.summary: Execute non-updating SQL statements.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier of the active connection.

parameters.name: sql
parameters.description: The query string to be executed.

returns.description: an object with the result data rows from the query provided.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: execute-update-prepared

functions.summary: Execute updating SQL statements prepared with jdbc:prepare-statement.

parameters.name: prepared-statement
parameters.description: The identifier of the prepared statement.

returns.description: the number of affected rows.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL006 The prepared statement is a non-updating query.</xqdoc:error>

functions.description: Verify if a connection is still active.
functions.summary: Verify if a connection is still active.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier of the connection to be verified.

returns.description: true if connected, false otherwise

functions.name: metadata
functions.description:
Return the metadata of the result of a DataSet.

More in detail, it returns information about column names, types, and whether a column can contain a null value. The metadata information can only be returned for DataSets that have been executed explicitly using the jdbc:execute function. The metadata node returned has the following structure: 

{
   "columns": [ {
       "name": string,
       "type": string,
       "autoincrement"? = boolean,
       "nillable"? = boolean } * ]
 }

If the query is an updating query, then the result object will return the number of affected rows like: 

{ "affectedrows": integer }
functions.summary: Return the metadata of the result of a DataSet.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: The identifier of the DataSet.

returns.description: the metadata associated with an executed DataSet.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: parameter-metadata
functions.summary: Retrieve the names and types of the prepared statement parameters.

parameters.name: prepared-statement
parameters.description: The identifier of the prepared statement.

returns.description: parameters metadata (name and type) associated with a prepared statement.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: prepare-statement
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $sql as string) as anyURI
functions.description:
Create a prepared statement for multiple executions with diferent parameters. Example: 
 jdbc:prepare-statement($connection, "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id=? AND age>?")
functions.summary: Create a prepared statement for multiple executions with diferent parameters.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier of the active connection.

parameters.name: sql
parameters.description: The query string to be executed.

returns.description: the identifier of the prepared statement.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

 Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation, as in

parameters.description: The identifier of the DataSet.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: tables-nondeterministic
functions.description:
Return the list of tables from a connection.

This function has the same semantics as tables#1, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Return the list of tables from a connection.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier to a connection.

returns.description: Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: tables-nondeterministic
functions.signature: ($conn as anyURI, $catalog as string?, $schema as string?, $table as string?) as object()*
functions.description:
Return the list of tables from a connection.

This function has the same semantics as tables#4, but is declared as being non deterministic and thus should only be used when result caching is not desired.
functions.summary: Return the list of tables from a connection.

parameters.name: conn
parameters.description: The identifier to a connection.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: A filter of the catalog name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: A filter of the schema name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: A filter of the name of the tables. Send empty-sequence for all tables.

returns.description: Return an object with the result data rows from the query provided, the data rows are defined as follows: { column:value* }* Every row is represented by an object of column-value representation of the returned SQL result.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">SQL001 Descriptive error, see error in attached message.</xqdoc:error>

variables.name: jdbc:READ-COMMITTED
variables.description: This variable represents the READ-COMMITTED Isolation Level.

variables.name: jdbc:READ-UNCOMMITTED
variables.description: This variable represents the READ-UNCOMMITTED Isolation Level.

variables.name: jdbc:REPEATABLE-READ
variables.description: This variable represents the REPEATABLE-READ Isolation Levels.

variables.name: jdbc:SERIALIZABLE
variables.description: This variable represents the SERIALIZABLE Isolation Levels.

variables.name: jdbc:CREDENTIALS-CATEGORY
variables.description: This variable represents the category for the credentials used.
